intro: Narcissus asturiensis, commonly known as the Asturian daffodil, is a rare and endemic species native to the region of Asturias in northern Spain. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white corona. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and mountainous areas, thriving in cool, moist climates. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in harsh conditions, and it blooms in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
